questions.text: Which actress starred as 'Policewoman' on TV, and was once married to Burt Bacharach?
questions.explanation:
Angie Dickinson.

	Born in 1931, in North Dakota, Angie starred in many films, including 1980's 'Dressed to Kill'.

questions.text: Jeanine Deckers was the real name of the Belgian 'Singing Nun', who had a number one Billboard tune in 1963. What was the song?
questions.explanation:
Dominique.

	The 1960s, what a decade! A 'Flying Nun' and a 'Singing Nun' too.

questions.text: Vivien Leigh won a Best Actress Academy Award, playing a woman named Blanche. What was Blanche's last name?
questions.explanation:
Dubois.

	The film was 1951's classic, 'A Streetcar Named Desire'.

questions.text: Emily Dickinson wrote more than 1,700 poems. How many were actually published during her lifetime?
questions.explanation:
7.

	Emily, a literary giant, from Amherst, Massachusetts, was a recluse.

questions.text: With whom did Rock Hudson star in the 1959 film 'Pillow Talk'?
questions.explanation:
Doris Day.

	Her real name is Doris Von Kappelhoff. What a mouthful!

questions.text: This lady, named Gala, was born in Russia. For over 50 years, she was the inspiration for her painter husband. What was her married name?
questions.explanation:
Dali.

	She was the wife of the great Spanish leader of the 'Surrealist Movement', Salvador Dali.

questions.text: Actress Faye Dunaway's real first name is _______ ?
questions.explanation:
Dorothy.

	She won an Oscar in 1976 for her work in 'Network'.

questions.text: Which English singer formed her own band in the 1970s, and had a hit when she teamed up with Elton John?
questions.explanation:
Kiki Dee.

	Kiki was born Pauline Matthews, in 1947, in Bradford, England.

questions.text: Which actress appeared in more Humphrey Bogart films than any other actress?
questions.explanation:
Bette Davis.

	Bette and Bogart starred in eight films together, including 'The Petrified Forest' and 'Kid Galahad'.

questions.text: Jenny Diver was known as England's greatest ________ ?
questions.explanation:
pickpocket.

	Born Mary Jones in the 1700s, Jenny was immortalized in 'Beggar's Opera'.
